SEARCH
Package util

Class CSVReader

java.lang.Object
util.CSVReader
public class CSVReader extends Object
Specialized CSV reading utility using OpenCSV library. Provides robust CSV file reading with error handling and validation.

This class wraps OpenCSV's CSVReader to provide:

  • Automatic resource management
  • Comprehensive error handling
  • Header validation
  • Empty file handling
  • Line-by-line and batch reading

Usage Example:


 List<String[]> records = CSVReader.readAllRecords("data/students.csv", true);
 for (String[] record : records) {
     String userId = record[0];
     String name = record[1];
     // Process record...
 }
Since:
2025-01-15
Version:
1.0
Author:
SC2002 SCED Group-6

  • Method Details

    • readAllRecords

      public static List<String[]> readAllRecords(String filePath, boolean skipHeader)
      Reads all records from a CSV file, optionally skipping the header row.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      skipHeader - true to skip the first row (header), false to include it
      Returns:
      list of string arrays, each representing one CSV record
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if file cannot be read or parsing fails

    • readHeader

      public static String[] readHeader(String filePath)
      Reads the header row from a CSV file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      Returns:
      array of header column names, or empty array if file is empty
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if file cannot be read

    • readRecordByIndex

      public static String[] readRecordByIndex(String filePath, int recordIndex, boolean hasHeader)
      Reads a single record by its row index (0-based, excluding header).
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      recordIndex - the 0-based index of the record to read
      hasHeader - true if the file has a header row
      Returns:
      the record as a string array, or null if index out of bounds
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if file cannot be read

    • countRecords

      public static int countRecords(String filePath, boolean hasHeader)
      Counts the number of records in a CSV file, excluding header if specified.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      hasHeader - true if the file has a header row to exclude from count
      Returns:
      the number of data records in the file
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if file cannot be read

    • validateHeaders

      public static boolean validateHeaders(String filePath, String[] expectedHeaders)
      Validates that a CSV file has the expected header columns.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      expectedHeaders - the expected header column names
      Returns:
      true if headers match exactly, false otherwise
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if file cannot be read

    • isEmptyRecord

      private static boolean isEmptyRecord(String[] record)
      Checks if a record is empty (all fields are null or whitespace).
      Parameters:
      record - the CSV record to check
      Returns:
      true if the record is empty, false otherwise

    • readAllRecordsAsList

      public static List<List<String>> readAllRecordsAsList(String filePath, boolean skipHeader)
      Reads all records and returns them as a list of lists (for easier manipulation).
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      skipHeader - true to skip the first row (header)
      Returns:
      list of lists, each inner list represents one CSV record
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if file cannot be read

    • readCSVWithHeaders

      public static List<Map<String,String>> readCSVWithHeaders(String filePath)
      Reads all records from a CSV file and returns them as a list of maps, where each map represents a record with column names as keys.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the CSV file
      Returns:
      list of maps, each map represents one CSV record with headers as keys
      Throws:
      DataPersistenceException - if file cannot be read or has no header
